channel.title: download warnings
channel.description: i believe in the download page there should be a warning when somebody attempts to download for windows or virtualbox, something along lines of "please read this" and it would redirect them to a whonix wiki page on windows host issues that can make whonix useless as well as virtualbox closed source nature

item.title: download warnings
item.dc:creator: quantum445
item.description:
thanks, didn’t know that virtualbox was open source!

but shouldn’t a windows download page have some kind of warning? i have my windows system very locked down yet it still spies on me like i didnt tweak anything, i’d expect that to completely defeat purpose of whonix no?

Read full topic

item.title: download warnings
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
quantum445:

virtualbox closed source nature

Not closed source. → https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Dev/VirtualBox#VirtualBox_Open_Source_vs_Closed_Source

What’s non-ideal is the compilation toolchain issue for the compiler of the BIOS. → https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Dev/VirtualBox#VirtualBox_Unavailable_in_Debian_main_due_to_Licensing_Issues

The compiler required to compile the BIOS is source-available, under Sybase Open Watcom Public License - Wikipedia, an OSI approved licensed but not FSF approved and not DFSG approved.

The licensing situation is being worked on and that’s great but that won’t increase the actual security of VirtualBox. →
Change the license of Open Watcom · Discussion #271 · open-watcom/open-watcom-v2 · GitHub

Read full topic
